generif.text: These results suggest that this enzyme has N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase activity in both the elongation and initiation of chondroitin sulfate synthesis.
plays a role in the initiation and elongation in the synthesis of chondroitin sulfate
higher expression in the fetal skin than in adult skin
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
CSGALNACT1 missense mutations are associated with neuropathies.
CSGalNAcT-1 exhibited higher enzymatic efficiency toward monosulfated trisaccharides substituted at C4 or C6 position of Gal1, and at C6 of Gal2 compared with the unsulfated oligosaccharide.
CSGalNAcT-1 and Hapln-1 may play important roles in the pathogenesis of Kashin-Beck disease and osteoarthritis.
In men, patients who had multiple sclerosis (MS) with S126L had a slower disease progression. This cSNP might be associated with the sex differences in clinical course of MS.
CSGALNACT1-congenital disorder of glycosylation: A mild skeletal dysplasia with advanced bone age.

BP.term: heparan sulfate proteoglycan biosynthetic process, polysaccharide chain biosynthetic process
chondroitin sulfate proteoglycan biosynthetic process, polysaccharide chain biosynthetic process

name: chondroitin sulfate N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase 1

kegg.name: Glycosaminoglycan biosynthesis - chondroitin sulfate / dermatan sulfate - Homo sapiens (human)

summary: This gene encodes an enzyme that transfers N-acetylglucosamine (GalNAc) to the core tetrasaccharide linker and to elongating chondroitin sulfate chains in proteoglycans. Knockout of the orthologous mouse gene indicates that the protein is necessary for normal cartilage development and aggrecan metabolism. Mutations in this gene are associated with multiple sclerosis progression, and with mild skeletal dysplasia and joint laxity. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2017].
